issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I made this simple repo to show the issue: https://github.com/alanasim/ag-grid-w-react-redux-example/

If you run that example and try to copy and paste a 4x10 or larger area of the grid you can already see there's a bit of a delay even with not much going on. The lag increases with larger paste areas, and with more derivations / visual updates as in our use case things got pretty slow even with small areas.

With the Redux action hooked in to update based on cellValueChanged it seems to draw out the clipboardService function and the multipleCellRange function runs multiple times according to Chrome performance panel (I'm using Chrome 60 btw).

An "all done" event or "paste started" + "paste stopped" or some type of flag on cellValueChanged to say it was from a paste could all be helpful. It would be ideal to still be able to use cellValueChanged for single-cell updates, but there is currently no way I could see to conditionally ignore that event if it was from a paste. I switched to listening for cellEditingStopped for non-paste updates and cellsFlashed to do a single bulk Redux update after ag-Grid handled the paste internally.

from: Alana Simoncelli @  Chronograph.pe
fields.summary: Performance issue when pasting into range

fields.description:
https://ag-grid.com/forum/showthread.php?tid=5373

from the user:

"Most grids that i have used in the passed have an option for sticky groups. So when you group by a certain column and start scrolling the group header sticks to the top of the grid until the next group is hit.

This is extremely helpful for our users when each group contains thousands of records (so they dont get lost).

Any chance this could be considered?

You can check Devexpress or Kendo UI for sticky group examples (they do it well)"
fields.summary: [sticky groups] have opened group rows float

fields.description:
Raised by Sophia:

sophialazarova [8:46 AM] 
I have smth for you guys! I consider this to be a bug or at least inconsistent behavior. For example, we group by "country" by dragging the country column to the top, we can see that the entries are grouped by country and the "country" field disappears from the child entries since it becomes the name of the group. However, when we decide to group again by country but by clicking the context menu of the "country" column and choosing "group by country", the "country" field doesn't disappear from the child entries and it's visible both as group name and as field for every child.


[8:46] 
http://recordit.co/89jmd4QxyK
fields.summary: Grouping by drag and drop, and grouping by column menu have different behaviour. Make them consistent

fields.description:
currenly getRowNode(id) only works for in memory.

for all the others, if the row node is in memory, should return it back.

in viewport, it's easy, just iterate through everything in rownode, then get it to return if found.

for infinite and enterprise, could do a simple forEachNode() and return when you find the node (not efficient), or you could create a id->node map for each block, and then ask each block in turn if it has the node (more code but efficient).
fields.summary: [rowNode] have getRowNode(id) work with all row models
